import React from 'react' // import * as BooksAPI from './BooksAPI' import './App.css' import styled, { css } from "styled-components" import SearchModal from './search' import Heading from './headings' import Header from './header' class BooksApp extends React.Component { state = { /** * TODO: Instead of using this state variable to keep track of which page * we're on, use the URL in the browser's address bar. This will ensure that * users can use the browser's back and forward buttons to navigate between * pages, as well as provide a good URL they can bookmark and share. */ showSearchPage: false } render() { return (
{this.state.showSearchPage ? ( ) : (
Currently Reading
  1. To Kill a Mockingbird
    Harper Lee
  2. Ender's Game
    Orson Scott Card

Want to Read

  1. 1776
    David McCullough
  2. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
    J.K. Rowling

Read

  1. The Hobbit
    J.R.R. Tolkien
  2. Oh, the Places You'll Go!
    Seuss
  3. The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
    Mark Twain
)}
) } } const Wrapper = styled.div` max-width:1080px; width:80%; margin:0 auto; padding:60px 0; ` const CurrentlyReading = styled.div` background-color:#F6F3F0; ` const BookshelfBooks = styled.div` display:flex; flex-direction:row; ` export default BooksApp;
